newsitem.title: UK: Expeditors boosts Asia/US based management.
newsitem.headline: Expeditors boosts Asia/US based management.

text.p: Seattle based freight forwarder Expeditors International has boosted its senior management in Asia as part of an expansion programme there.
In New Delhi, Kurt Meister has been named regional director India and Pakistan having previously been managing director India.
Christopher Tay has been appointed to the new position of director of distribution Far East in Singapore from where he will lead a drive to boost business.
In the U.S., Portland has a new district manager, John Neville, who replaces Brad Schock who has been made global program manager for the Tektronic account.
In New York Ed Nagle has been given the new position of manager of business development with Steve Grimmer taking over as district sales manager.
Alan Feucht has joined the head office team in the new position of director of U.S. ocean freight forwarding services. - Reuters Air Cargo Newsroom Tel+44 171 542 7706 Fax:5017
